intro: Elatostema goudotianum var. tsaratananae, commonly known as the Madagascar snowflake, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical research.
